channel.title: California
channel.description: California news and features from the Los Angeles Times.

item.title: UC raises tuition despite student outcry, touting more financial aid and budget stability
item.dc:creator: Teresa Watanabe
item.description: University of California regents OK a tuition hike for incoming undergraduates starting in fall 2022. Critics say it will hurt vulnerable students.
item.content:encoded: University of California regents OK a tuition hike for incoming undergraduates starting in fall 2022. Critics say it will hurt vulnerable students.

media:content.media:description: MARCH 10, 2017 CA BERKELEY, CA Students play and study around the campus of the University of California at Berkeley. Photo by David Butow/for the Times

item.title: They ignited #FreeBritney. Now 'Britney's Gram' hosts have an investigative Spears podcast
item.dc:creator: Margy Rochlin
item.description: Tess Barker and Babs Gray go from courtroom to podcasting mics to report their new 'Toxic' deep-dive look into Britney Spears' conservatorship case.
item.content:encoded: Tess Barker and Babs Gray go from courtroom to podcasting mics to report their new 'Toxic' deep-dive look into Britney Spears' conservatorship case.

media:content.media:description: (L-R) Babs Gray and Tess Barker, the two hosts of the new investigative podcast called "Toxic." They are recording Britney's Gram in Tess's garage in Eagle rock.

item.title: Dixie fire reaches megafire status while Tamarack fire crosses state lines
item.dc:creator: Hayley Smith
item.description: The Dixie fire is now the second fire in California to surpass 100,000 acres this year, after the Sugar fire.
item.content:encoded: The Dixie fire is now the second fire in California to surpass 100,000 acres this year, after the Sugar fire.

media:content.media:description: Firefighters battle the Tamarack Fire in the Markleeville community of Alpine County, Calif., on Saturday, July 17, 2021. (AP Photo/Noah Berger)

item.title: L.A. County's alarming new coronavirus surge: How bad will it get?
item.dc:creator: Luke Money, Rong-Gong Lin II
item.description: As COVID-19 cases rise again in Los Angeles County, people who aren't vaccinated make up the vast majority of new infections.
item.content:encoded: As COVID-19 cases rise again in Los Angeles County, people who aren't vaccinated make up the vast majority of new infections.

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CA - JULY 16, 2021 - - Travelers exit Metro Rail and enter the Union Station West Passageway in Los Angeles on Friday, July 16, 2021. Starting Saturday night, residents will again be required to wear masks in indoor public spaces, regardless of their vaccination status. Just a month ago, Los Angeles County and the rest of California celebrated a long-awaited reopening, marking the tremendous progress made in the battle against COVID-19 by lifting virtually all restrictions on businesses and other public spaces. Now, the coronavirus is resurgent, and the nation's most-populous county is scrambling to beat back the pandemic's latest charge. (Genaro Molina / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: From air purifiers to filters, how to protect yourself from wildfire smoke
item.dc:creator: Hayley Smith
item.description: Buy a portable air filter in advance of fire season, one expert said, 'because once there's a fire and the smoke is bad, then there's a run on them.'
item.content:encoded: Buy a portable air filter in advance of fire season, one expert said, 'because once there's a fire and the smoke is bad, then there's a run on them.'

media:content.media:description: FILE - In this Sept. 9, 2020, file photo, taken at 11:18 a.m., is a dark orange sky above Crissy Field and the city caused by heavy smoke from wildfires in San Francisco. Wildfires that scorched huge swaths of the West Coast churned out massive plumes of choking smoke that blanketed millions of people with hazardous pollution that spiked emergency room visits and that experts say could continue generating health problems for years. An Associated Press analysis of air quality data shows 5.2 million people in five states were hit with hazardous levels of pollution for at least a day. (AP Photo/Eric Risberg, File)

item.title: Report on powerful water agency finds no widespread issues in handling employee complaints
item.dc:creator: Adam Elmahrek
item.description: A review of the Metropolitan Water District of Southern California found no systemic problems in how the agency handled complaints of harassment, racism and other alleged discrimination.
item.content:encoded: A review of the Metropolitan Water District of Southern California found no systemic problems in how the agency handled complaints of harassment, racism and other alleged discrimination.

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CA - MARCH 09: Metropolitan Water District headquarters located at 700 Alameda Street in downtown Los Angeles. The Metropolitan Water District headquarters is considered distant from the people that are responsible for operating and maintaining the pumping plants, reservoirs and pipelines that deliver much of Southern California's drinking water. Los Angeles on Tuesday, March 9, 2021 in Los Angeles, CA. (Al Seib / Los Angeles Times).

item.title: Traffic is terrible again. Here's how to get it closer to spring 2020 levels
item.dc:creator: Rachel Schnalzer
item.description: Traffic has long been a headache in Southern California â but there are ways to cut down on the congestion.
item.content:encoded: Traffic has long been a headache in Southern California â but there are ways to cut down on the congestion.

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CA MARCH 27, 2015 - Sunrise for drivers as morning traffic begins to swell on the East and West bound 101 Freeway in the San Fernando Valley near White Oak on the second day of a heat wave brought on by a high pressure system over the area on March 27, 2015. (Al Seib / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Podcast: Hey, Pete Wilson decided to talk to us
item.description: Former California Gov. Pete Wilson discusses Proposition 187, "the right way" to immigrate and how our host's family should feel about him.
item.content:encoded: Former California Gov. Pete Wilson discusses Proposition 187, "the right way" to immigrate and how our host's family should feel about him.

item.description: Garcetti spokesman Alex Comisar told reporters last fall that neither the city nor the mayor were told of any harassment allegations regarding the advisor.

item.title: From heavy metals to COVID-19, wildfire smoke is more dangerous than you think

item.description: As wildfires ravage hundreds of thousands of acres across California, more is being learned about the damaging effects of their smoke.
item.content:encoded: As wildfires ravage hundreds of thousands of acres across California, more is being learned about the damaging effects of their smoke.

media:content.media:description: Smoke envelops trees as the Sugar Fire, part of the Beckwourth Complex Fire, burns in Doyle, Calif., Friday, July 9, 2021. (AP Photo/Noah Berger)

item.title: As drought slams California and Oregon, Klamath farmers grow fish to quell a water war
item.dc:creator: Anita Chabria, Hailey Branson-Potts
item.description: In the Klamath basin, some farmers hope to head off potential violence by repopulating fish that are part of a decades-old water and wildlife conflict.
item.content:encoded: In the Klamath basin, some farmers hope to head off potential violence by repopulating fish that are part of a decades-old water and wildlife conflict.

media:content.media:description: Klamath Falls, Oregon, Wednesday, June 9, 2021 - Farmer Tracey LIskey believes his efforts to save the endangered Sucker fish will benefit farmers along the Klamath Project. The Gone Fishing complex is home to thousands of endangered Sucker fish that will eventually be released back to the Upper Klamath Lake. (Robert Gauthier/Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Graphic videos, victims lay bare the horror of Ed Buck's deadly 'party and play' fetish

item.title: Michael Avenatti accused at fraud trial of stealing from client to buy private jet

item.content:encoded: Former L.A. lawyer for porn actress Stormy Daniels is now a convicted felon representing himself at the second of his four criminal trials

media:content.media:description: Michael Avenatti arrives for a scheduled sentencing at Manhattan federal court, Thursday, July 8, 2021, in New York. The California lawyer who publicly sparred with then-President Donald Trump before criminal fraud charges disrupted his rapid ascent to fame faces sentencing after a jury concluded he tried to extort millions of dollars from Nike. (AP Photo/John Minchillo)

item.title: L.A. County sees big surge in coronavirus: 2,551 new cases in one day
item.dc:creator: Luke Money
item.description: The positivity rate now stands at 5.2% in Los Angeles County, and health officials say that cases have increased twentyfold over the last month.
item.content:encoded: The positivity rate now stands at 5.2% in Los Angeles County, and health officials say that cases have increased twentyfold over the last month.

media:content.media:description: HIGHLAND PARK, CA - JULY 16: Sam Weissler, left, enjoys an ice coffee while Ryan Maldonado, 30, right, is painting inside a window at Three Kings Tattoo on Friday, July 16, 2021 in Highland Park, CA. Starting Saturday night, residents will again be required to wear masks in indoor public spaces, regardless of their vaccination status. Just a month ago, Los Angeles County and the rest of California celebrated a long-awaited reopening, marking the tremendous progress made in the battle against COVID-19 by lifting virtually all restrictions on businesses and other public spaces. Now, the coronavirus is resurgent, and the nation's most-populous county is scrambling to beat back the pandemic's latest charge.(Francine Orr / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Port-a-potty truck speeds off. Deputies smell trouble

media:content.media:description: PALOS VERDES ESTATES, CA.-- JUNE 7, 2015--A home for sale at 2744 Via Anita, listed at $1,450,000, photographed June 7, 2015. The 2,420 sq ft residence is in the Valmonte "grove" area and has views of the Palos Verdes Golf Course, three bedrooms and two baths, on a 7,149sq ft lot. (Jay L. Clendenin / Los Angeles Times)

item.content:encoded: Of the Downey High teens rescued, two became separated from the group and spent a frigid night on Mt. Baldy before being found.

item.title: Harvey Weinstein pleads not guilty to rape charges in L.A.
item.dc:creator: James Queally
item.description: Weinstein, 69, pleads not guilty to multiple counts of sexual assault involving five women between 2004 and 2013.
item.content:encoded: Weinstein, 69, pleads not guilty to multiple counts of sexual assault involving five women between 2004 and 2013.

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CA - JULY 21: Attorney Gloria Allred who is representing alleged victims of disgraced former film producer Harvey Weinstein talks outside Los Angeles Superior Court where Weinstein appeared for arraignment charged with sex-related counts involving five women between 2004 and 2013. Weinstein was extradited from New York to Los Angeles. "Today Harvey Weinstein was brought to LA stemming from an extradition warrant that was issued for several felony sexual assault charges,'' the Los Angeles Police Department tweeted. "After being medically cleared for booking, he was booked into custody (with) LA County Sheriff's.'' Superior Court on Wednesday, July 21, 2021 in Los Angeles, CA. (Al Seib / Los Angeles Times).

item.title: Do I need to wear a mask indoors in my community? Rules vary across California
item.dc:creator: Luke Money, Rong-Gong Lin II
item.description: One-third of California counties are now urging even fully vaccinated people to wear masks indoors as coronavirus cases continue to rise.
item.content:encoded: One-third of California counties are now urging even fully vaccinated people to wear masks indoors as coronavirus cases continue to rise.

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CA - MAY 17: Signage inside Target reads that there is a mask mandate on the first day it has dropped the requirement for fully vaccinated customers, joining with Walmart, Trader Joes, Starbucks, Costco and other businesses in downtown on Monday, May 17, 2021 in Los Angeles, CA. (Dania Maxwell / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Staffing shortages, exhaustion, family vacations temper big summer-school hopes
item.dc:creator: Laura Newberry
item.description: A $4.6-billion funding surge has allowed most California districts to open summer school and enrichment programs. But attendance is spotty.
item.content:encoded: A $4.6-billion funding surge has allowed most California districts to open summer school and enrichment programs. But attendance is spotty.

media:content.media:description: PASADENA, CALIFORNIA: Nelli Tergrigoryan leads students in a stretching exercise during a LEARNs summer program at Washington Elementary School in Pasadena on Friday, July 9, 2021. In the wake of pandemic-related learning loss, districts across California had high hopes for Summer programs that might help catch kids up-and there's unprecedented state funding to do so. (Christina House / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Plummeting reservoir levels could soon force Oroville hydropower offline
item.dc:creator: Julia Wick
item.description: The Edward Hyatt Powerplant at Lake Oroville could go offline as soon as August and trigger a potential power crunch this summer.
item.content:encoded: The Edward Hyatt Powerplant at Lake Oroville could go offline as soon as August and trigger a potential power crunch this summer.

media:content.media:description: OROVILLE, CA - JUNE 29: A kayaker on the water at Lake Oroville, which stands at 33 percent full and 40 percent of historical average when this photograph was taken on Tuesday, June 29, 2021 in Oroville, CA. (Brian van der Brug / Los Angeles Times)
media:content.media:credit: Brian van der Brug/Los Angeles Times

item.title: Drone photos reveal the shocking truth of California's parched landscape

item.description: Lake Oroville, Folsom Lake and Trinity Lake provide a glimpse into the state's dry spell.
item.content:encoded: Lake Oroville, Folsom Lake and Trinity Lake provide a glimpse into the state's dry spell.

media:content.media:description: FOLSOM, CA - JULY 01: Boat slips lay stranded on dry land as water levels recede at drought-stricken Folsom Lake, which stands XX% full, but the average for the date is XX% of average, reflecting the ongoing drought when this photograph was taken on Thursday, July 1, 2021 in Folsom, CA. (Brian van der Brug / Los Angeles Times)
media:content.media:credit: Brian van der Brug/Los Angeles Times

item.title: California coronavirus hospitalizations hit highest point in months as Delta spreads
item.dc:creator: Luke Money
item.description: Statewide, the number of coronavirus-positive patients in the hospital more than doubled in the last month, and the rate has climbed further in the last two weeks.
item.content:encoded: Statewide, the number of coronavirus-positive patients in the hospital more than doubled in the last month, and the rate has climbed further in the last two weeks.

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CA - JULY 17: Visitors to Chinatown wear masks even when outdoors. The LA County mask mandate will go into effect at 11:59 p.m. Saturday, July 17, 2021 requiring masks be worn indoors with the exception that masks can be removed if dining in a restaurant. Photographed in Chinatown on Saturday, July 17, 2021 in Los Angeles, CA. (Myung J. Chun / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Column: Apocalypse, cow â our growing drought and the great L.A. cattle escape
item.dc:creator: Gustavo Arellano
item.description: A look at historic drought and the drought now facing the West through the lens of a recent cattle escapade -- an adventure that ended well for two cows.
item.content:encoded: A look at historic drought and the drought now facing the West through the lens of a recent cattle escapade -- an adventure that ended well for two cows.

media:content.media:description: ACTON, CA - JULY 16: Jessica Due, National Director of animal care for Farm Sanctuary hugs Safran known as "Saffy" a rescued holstein dairy cow at the Farm Sanctuary in Acton where "June B. Free" and "Susan" are now living after the pair survived from a group of cows that temporarily escaped a Pico Rivera slaughterhouse in June and captivated Southern California. The two cows will be introduced to the other cattle after they acclimate to their new surroundings. They are part of another story about the worst drought in Southern California history: the 1863 drought that left hundreds of thousands of cows dead. Farm Sanctuary on Friday, July 16, 2021 in Acton, CA. (Al Seib / Los Angeles Times).

item.title: LAPD investigates claims of excessive force at Wi Spa protest
item.dc:creator: Kevin Rector, Leila Miller, Laura J. Nelson
item.description: LAPD Chief Michel Moore said officials are investigating allegations of excessive force during a protest Saturday outside a Westlake spa.
item.content:encoded: LAPD Chief Michel Moore said officials are investigating allegations of excessive force during a protest Saturday outside a Westlake spa.

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CA - JULY 20: Attorney's Humberto Guizar, left, and Christian Contreras, right, with Vishal Singh, center, aa independent journalist wearing a cast over his injury as attorneys with Justice X held a news conference outside LAPD Headquarters to announce lawsuits against the LAPD over its alleged targeted attacks against journalists and activists during anti-transgender and counter protests associated with Wi Spa, a Koreatown business with a trans-inclusive policy that gained notoriety when a customer filmed herself complaining about a trans woman in the women's area of the establishment, contact says. Justice X contends that LAPD officers ``illegally fired deadly projectiles at defenseless protesters, attacked innocent protesters with batons and other weapons and were harboring white supremacists in violation of constitutional rights.'' LAPD Headquarters on Tuesday, July 20, 2021 in Los Angeles, CA. (Al Seib / Los Angeles Times).

item.title: 'Just unbelievably horrifying': Woman with dementia allegedly kidnapped from Wilshire VA parking lot
item.dc:creator: Julia Wick
item.description: The woman was freed on Monday afternoon, when FBI agents arrested the alleged kidnapper outside an East Hollywood motel.
item.content:encoded: The woman was freed on Monday afternoon, when FBI agents arrested the alleged kidnapper outside an East Hollywood motel.

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CA-APRIL 6, 2020: Overall, shows a homeless encampment on Wilshire Blvd in Los Angeles, located just outside the grounds of the VA West Los Angeles Campus. The VA is opening the campus to camping by homeless veterans in a designated parking lot and also 2 sprung shelters that will have 25 beds in each. The VA had long rejected camping or more interim housing on the 388 acre campus saying vets had ample shelter space but Covid-19 pandemic reversed that position. (Mel Melcon/Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Newsom administration hires special counsel in probe of California unemployment fraud

item.content:encoded: State officials have hired former federal prosecutor McGregor Scott to serve as special counsel to assist in investigating fraud in California's unemployment benefits system.

media:content.media:description: FILE - In this Jan. 24, 2020, file photo, McGregor Scott, the U.S. Attorney for the Eastern District of California, answers questions at a news conference in Sacramento Calif. U.S. Attorney Scott said on Monday, Nov. 30, 2020 that Samuel Keeton, 41, of Menifee, pleaded guilty to conspiracy to participate in a racketeering enterprise and to conspiracy to distribute heroin and methamphetamine. (AP Photo/Rich Pedroncelli, File)

item.title: Ex-DEA agent from California charged in U.S. Capitol insurrection
item.dc:creator: James Queally
item.description: Mark Sami Ibrahim, of Orange County, is accused of bringing a firearm to the Capitol and then lying to the FBI about his activities, according to court filings.
item.content:encoded: Mark Sami Ibrahim, of Orange County, is accused of bringing a firearm to the Capitol and then lying to the FBI about his activities, according to court filings.

media:content.media:description: FILE - In this Jan. 6, 2021, file photo insurrectionists loyal to President Donald Trump breach the Capitol in Washington. Prosecutors secured the first guilty plea in the major case brought against members of the Oath Keepers extremist group in the attack on the U.S. Capitol, while an Indiana woman who became first person to be sentenced for the Jan. 6 riot avoided time behind bars. (AP Photo/John Minchillo)

item.title: New wildfire sends residents scrambling in Butte County
item.dc:creator: Hayley Smith
item.description: The fire ignited just before noon, and mandatory evacuation orders were issued within minutes as the fire quickly spread. In about an hour, however, the evacuations were called off.
item.content:encoded: The fire ignited just before noon, and mandatory evacuation orders were issued within minutes as the fire quickly spread. In about an hour, however, the evacuations were called off.

media:content.media:description: In this screen shot from a PGER&E web camera, a vegetation fire ignited in Butte County burns on Tuesday

item.title: As COVID cases skyrocket with the Delta variant, it's easier than ever to get a vaccine
item.dc:creator: Ada Tseng, Jessica Roy, Madalyn Amato
item.description: It used to be hard to find a vaccine appointment. Not any more. Here's how to get your COVID-19 shot.
item.content:encoded: It used to be hard to find a vaccine appointment. Not any more. Here's how to get your COVID-19 shot.

media:content.media:description: RIVERSIDE, CA - FEBRUARY 1, 2021: Robert Nelson,81, of Riverside holds his wife Norma's hand as they walk to the observation lounge area after he received the Moderna vaccination in the parking lot of the Riverside Convention Center on February 1, 2021 in Riverside, California. Norma,83, received her vaccination a couple days earlier. Currently, this site is capable of giving 500 vaccinations a day in one of the regions hardest hit by the pandemic. Only residents 65 and older and educators are eligible for the vaccination here.(Gina Ferazzi / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Tom Barrack, L.A. investor and Trump ally, charged with acting as agent of UAE

media:content.media:description: SANTA MONICA, CA - DECEMBER 14, 2016 - Thomas J. Barrack Jr. the American private equity real estate investor and the founder, chairman and chief executive officer of Colony Capital, headquartered in Los Angeles, California photographed in his Santa Monica home December 14, 2016. He is the chairman of the Trump Presidential Inaugural Committee. (Al Seib / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Six more California counties ask people to wear masks indoors as Delta variant rages
item.dc:creator: Luke Money
item.description: Six more California counties are urging masks in indoor public spaces amid upticks in coronavirus cases and circulation of the Delta variant.
item.content:encoded: Six more California counties are urging masks in indoor public spaces amid upticks in coronavirus cases and circulation of the Delta variant.

media:content.media:description: SOUTH PASADENA, CA - JULY 18: Lilian Zhu, 17, is working at her laptop wearing her face mask inside Charlie's Coffee House during the coronavirus pandemic on Sunday, July 18, 2021 in South Pasadena, CA. Once again the Los Angeles County on Sunday began requiring people to wear masks in indoor public places, opening a new battle line as the coronavirus is rising significantly among unvaccinated people. L.A. County is by far the biggest jurisdiction in the nation to require masks again. But with coronavirus cases rising across the nation largely because of the highly infectious Delta variant, officials elsewhere will be watching to see if the effort works. (Francine Orr / Los Angeles Times)

County Department of Public Health at Mothers in Action on Friday, July 16, 2021 in Los Angeles, CA. (Irfan Khan / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Photos: Thousands witness Lady of La Vang statue unveiling
item.dc:creator: Allen J. Schaben
item.description: See the statue of the Virgin Mary that represents hope and faith for Vietnamese Catholics.
item.content:encoded: See the statue of the Virgin Mary that represents hope and faith for Vietnamese Catholics.

media:content.media:description: Garden Grove, CA - July 17: Catholics raise they hands during the blessing of the Eucharist during Mass as thousands of faithful flock to Christ Cathedral to witness "blessed" unveiling of Our Lady of La Vang statue at Christ Cathedral on Saturday, July 17, 2021 in Garden Grove, CA. Thousands of faithful flock to cathedral to witness "blessed" unveiling of Our Lady of La Vang statue. Stand-alone art of the unveiling/blessing of the new $12.6 million shrine, with a centerpiece showing Our Lady of La Vang statue, the first large-scale rendition in the U.S. of a figure sacred to Vietnamese Catholics. Between 5,000 to 8,000 visitors were expected for the festivities. (Allen J. Schaben / Los Angeles Times)

After she spoke during a news conference outside LAPD Headquarters to announce lawsuits against the LAPD over its alleged targeted attacks against journalists and activists during anti-transgender and counter protests associated with Wi Spa, a Koreatown business with a trans-inclusive policy that gained notoriety when a customer filmed herself complaining about a trans woman in the women's area of the establishment, contact says. Justice X contends that LAPD officers ``illegally fired deadly projectiles at defenseless protesters, attacked innocent protesters with batons and other weapons and were harboring white supremacists in violation of constitutional rights.'' LAPD Headquarters on Tuesday, July 20, 2021 in Los Angeles, CA. (Al Seib / Los Angeles Times).

item.title: California Community Colleges chancellor to take temporary job with Biden administration

item.content:encoded: California Community Colleges Chancellor Eloy Ortiz Oakley will take a temporary post advising U.S. Education Secretary Miguel Cardona on higher education issues, including raising the federal Pell Grant for low-income students.

media:content.media:description: Eloy Ortiz Oakley talks to reporters after he was named chancellor of the California Community Colleges on Monday, July 18, 2016, in Sacramento, Calif. Oakley, the superintendent-president of the Long Beach Community College District, and a University of California regent, is the first Latino to head the 113-community college system. (AP Photo/Rich Pedroncelli)

item.title: Caltech says it regrets drilling holes in sacred Native American petroglyph site
item.dc:creator: Louis SahagÃºn
item.description: Caltech has agreed to pay $25,465 to cover restoration costs after a researcher damaged a protected petroglyph site sacred to Native Americans.
item.content:encoded: Caltech has agreed to pay $25,465 to cover restoration costs after a researcher damaged a protected petroglyph site sacred to Native Americans.

media:content.media:description: BISHOP, CA - JULY 12: Fish Slough Petroglyph site in the U.S. Bureau of Land Management's Volcanic Tablelands area on Monday, July 12, 2021 in Bishop, CA. Joseph Kirschvink, a professor of geoscience and faculty member, from the California Institute of Technology, known for its strength in science and engineering, had used a portable pneumatic drill to extract core samples for paleomagnetic studies. In the process, the site was riddled with 29, 1-inch diameter holes marked with blue paint. The area is located in the eastern Sierra Nevada range. Gary Coronado / Los Angeles Times)

item.content:encoded: A shirtless man scaled a tower that stands over 300 feet at Knott's Berry Farm on Saturday night, drawing police and emergency responders to the Orange County amusement park.

media:content.media:description: BUEANA PARK CA OCTOBER 20, 2020 - Aerial view of the closed Knott's Berry Farm theme park in Buena Park, Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2020. Protocols announced Tuesday allow a large theme park to reopen once coronavirus transmission in its home county falls enough for the county to reach Tier 4 - the state's least restrictive designation. Orange County, home of Disneyland, Disney California Adventure Park and Knott's Berry Farm, is currently in the second-most restrictive. (Allen J. Schaben / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: California recall candidate lineup revealed, but generates less excitement than in 2003

item.title: L.A. County indoor mask rules set to take effect as coronavirus cases keep rising
item.dc:creator: Hannah Fry, Luke Money, Rong-Gong Lin II
item.description: Officials hope more masking will help contain the hyper-contagious Delta variant of the coronavirus, which is easily spread and has been blamed for increased infections across the country. The mandate goes into effect midnight Saturday.
item.content:encoded: Officials hope more masking will help contain the hyper-contagious Delta variant of the coronavirus, which is easily spread and has been blamed for increased infections across the country. The mandate goes into effect midnight Saturday.

media:content.media:description: HIGHLAND PARK, CA - JULY 16: Wearing a mask Peter Hawks, an apprentece tatooer sweeps inside Three Kings Tattoo on Friday, July 16, 2021 in Highland Park, CA. Starting Saturday night, residents will again be required to wear masks in indoor public spaces, regardless of their vaccination status. Just a month ago, Los Angeles County and the rest of California celebrated a long-awaited reopening, marking the tremendous progress made in the battle against COVID-19 by lifting virtually all restrictions on businesses and other public spaces. Now, the coronavirus is resurgent, and the nation's most-populous county is scrambling to beat back the pandemic's latest charge.(Francine Orr / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Photos: It's 'Time for Fun': O.C. Fair is back this summer

The theme is ``Time for Fun.'' (Allen J. Schaben / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Skeletal remains found in Ballona Wetlands during search for L.A. woman missing since December
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Reyes-Velarde
item.description: Authorities continue to search for Mar Vista resident Kolby Story. During an investigation, skeletal remains were found in the Ballona Wetlands.
item.content:encoded: Authorities continue to search for Mar Vista resident Kolby Story. During an investigation, skeletal remains were found in the Ballona Wetlands.

item.title: L.A. County sees another sharp rise in coronavirus cases as mask rules set to take effect
item.dc:creator: Rong-Gong Lin II, Luke Money
item.description: L.A. County recorded more than 1,900 new coronavirus cases Friday, another major jump. Masks are required in public places starting Saturday night.
item.content:encoded: L.A. County recorded more than 1,900 new coronavirus cases Friday, another major jump. Masks are required in public places starting Saturday night.

media:content.media:description: HIGHLAND PARK, CA - JULY 16: Wearing a mask Peter Hawks, an apprentece tatooer sweeps inside Three Kings Tattoo on Friday, July 16, 2021 in Highland Park, CA. Starting Saturday night, residents will again be required to wear masks in indoor public spaces, regardless of their vaccination status. Just a month ago, Los Angeles County and the rest of California celebrated a long-awaited reopening, marking the tremendous progress made in the battle against COVID-19 by lifting virtually all restrictions on businesses and other public spaces. Now, the coronavirus is resurgent, and the nation's most-populous county is scrambling to beat back the pandemic's latest charge.(Francine Orr / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: With mask mandate, L.A. County now leads national battle against the Delta variant
item.dc:creator: Luke Money, Emily Alpert Reyes, Rong-Gong Lin II
item.description: 'Anything is on the table if things continue to get worse, which is why we want to take action now,' the L.A. County health officer said.
item.content:encoded: 'Anything is on the table if things continue to get worse, which is why we want to take action now,' the L.A. County health officer said.

media:content.media:description: HIGHLAND PARK, CA - JULY 16: Sam Weissler, left, enjoys an ice coffee while Ryan Maldonado, 30, right, is painting inside a window at Three Kings Tattoo on Friday, July 16, 2021 in Highland Park, CA. Starting Saturday night, residents will again be required to wear masks in indoor public spaces, regardless of their vaccination status. Just a month ago, Los Angeles County and the rest of California celebrated a long-awaited reopening, marking the tremendous progress made in the battle against COVID-19 by lifting virtually all restrictions on businesses and other public spaces. Now, the coronavirus is resurgent, and the nation's most-populous county is scrambling to beat back the pandemic's latest charge.(Francine Orr / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Photos: New mask mandate, L.A. County now leading national battle against Delta variant
item.description: New mask mandate takes effect in L.A. County
item.content:encoded: New mask mandate takes effect in L.A. County

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CA - JULY 16, 2021 - - A traveler, reflected in public art, "City of Dreams/River of History" by May Sun and Richard Wyatt, walks through the Union Station West Passageway in Los Angeles on Friday, July 16, 2021. Starting Saturday night, residents will again be required to wear masks in indoor public spaces, regardless of their vaccination status. Just a month ago, Los Angeles County and the rest of California celebrated a long-awaited reopening, marking the tremendous progress made in the battle against COVID-19 by lifting virtually all restrictions on businesses and other public spaces. Now, the coronavirus is resurgent, and the nation's most-populous county is scrambling to beat back the pandemic's latest charge. (Genaro Molina / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Rite Aid worker killed after confronting shoplifters at Glassell Park store, police say
item.dc:creator: Leila Miller
item.description: A Rite Aid employee was killed Thursday night when he confronted two people suspected of shoplifting at the Glassell Park store, police said.
item.content:encoded: A Rite Aid employee was killed Thursday night when he confronted two people suspected of shoplifting at the Glassell Park store, police said.

item.title: As list of recall candidates takes shape, Jenner's in Australia for a TV show
item.dc:creator: Seema Mehta, Julia Wick
item.description: No prominent Democrat files to run in the recall election
item.content:encoded: No prominent Democrat files to run in the recall election

media:content.media:description: NORWALK, CA - JULY 16, 2021: Criminal defense attorney Dan Kapelovitz of Hollywood reacts after filling his paperwork to be a recall candidate for governor at the County Registrar on July, 16, 2021 in Norwalk, California.(Gina Ferazzi / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Under fire, Feuer defends his office's handling of DWP billing litigation
item.dc:creator: Dakota Smith
item.description: The report concluded the scheme let opposing attorneys collect $19 million in fees, an amount investigators called "excessive"
item.content:encoded: The report concluded the scheme let opposing attorneys collect $19 million in fees, an amount investigators called "excessive"

item.title: U-Haul with 600 pounds of chlorine powder catches fire in Signal Hill
item.dc:creator: Leila Miller
item.description: A U-Haul truck carrying about 600 pounds of chlorine powder caught on fire in Signal Hill on Thursday afternoon, sending plumes of smoke into the air.
item.content:encoded: A U-Haul truck carrying about 600 pounds of chlorine powder caught on fire in Signal Hill on Thursday afternoon, sending plumes of smoke into the air.

item.title: A Yuba County man said he killed 4 deer. DNA revealed 'egregious' poaching case
item.dc:creator: Lila Seidman
item.description: A Yuba County game warden's suspicions over a 'shady' deer killing are confirmed when DNA analysis reveals the illegal killing of seven does.
item.content:encoded: A Yuba County game warden's suspicions over a 'shady' deer killing are confirmed when DNA analysis reveals the illegal killing of seven does.

media:content.media:description: California wildlife officials used DNA analysis of deer meat samples to prove a Yuba County man illegally killed more deer than he initially admitted to. These deer were photographed near where the deer were poached.
media:content.media:credit: California Department of Fish and Wildlife

item.title: Column: Mad about the new mask mandate? Blame Donald Trump and Tucker Carlson
item.dc:creator: Steve Lopez
item.description: L.A. County's new mandate calls for even the vaccinated to wear masks indoors. Steve Lopez says that's unfair but has one argument for GOP doubters.
item.content:encoded: L.A. County's new mandate calls for even the vaccinated to wear masks indoors. Steve Lopez says that's unfair but has one argument for GOP doubters.

media:content.media:description: Former President Donald Trump speaks during a visit to an unfinished section of border wall with Texas Gov. Greg Abbott, in Pharr, Texas, Wednesday, June 30, 2021. (AP Photo/Eric Gay)

item.title: Bird rescue operation in Long Beach seeks to save elegant terns
item.dc:creator: Faith E. Pinho
item.description: A few thousand elegant terns have settled on two barges in the Long Beach Harbor, just weeks after a drone crash disrupted a colony at Bolsa Chica Ecological Reserve.
item.content:encoded: A few thousand elegant terns have settled on two barges in the Long Beach Harbor, just weeks after a drone crash disrupted a colony at Bolsa Chica Ecological Reserve.

media:content.media:description: San Pedro, CA - July 16: Lauren DuBois, a wildlife center volunteer, prepares to give an elegant tern its breakfast at the Los Angeles Oiled Bird Care on Friday, July 16, 2021, in San Pedro, CA. (Madeleine Hordinski / Los Angeles Times)

item.title: Inglewood announces new parking permit restrictions tied to SoFi Stadium
item.dc:creator: Hayley Smith
item.description: Beginning this fall, permits will be required to park for more than two hours on any city street outside the hours of 8 a.m. to 5 pm.
item.content:encoded: Beginning this fall, permits will be required to park for more than two hours on any city street outside the hours of 8 a.m. to 5 pm.

media:content.media:description: INGLEWOOD, CA - SEPTEMBER 08: Los Angeles Rams and Los Angeles Chargers hosted the official ribbon-cutting ceremony for the new SoFi Stadium on Tuesday September 8, 2020 ahead of the inaugural first game as the Rams as hosts to the Cowboys this Sunday September 13, 2020, followed by the Chargers versus the Chiefs on September 20. The ceremony included Rams Owner/Chairman and SoFi Stadium and Hollywood Park developer E. Stanley Kroenke, Chargers Owner/Chairman Dean Spanos and the City of Inglewood's Mayor James T. Butts. The stadium is the first football stadium to be built within Los Angeles in Nearly 100 years. "We are in the team business, and you can't get to a moment like today without a great team. I would like to thank the 17,000 people who have worked on this project over the past four years," said Rams Owner/Chairman Stan Kroenke. "During a period of unrest and change in many parts of the country, it's been our deepest privilege to work on a project this special with such a diverse workforce. Thank you for making our vision a reality." SoFi Stadium is the first indoor-outdoor stadium and seats approximately 70,000, expandable up to 100,000. SoFi Stadium is located at Hollywood Park, a near 300-acre sports and entertainment destination being developed by Kroenke in Inglewood and at 3.1 million square-foot SoFi Stadium is the largest stadium in the NFL. SoFi Stadium on Tuesday, Sept. 8, 2020 in Inglewood, CA. (Al Seib / Los Angeles Times

item.title: Flexing new authority, California attorney general to review LAPD shooting in Hollywood
item.dc:creator: Kevin Rector
item.description: Flexing new authority, California Atty. Gen. Rob Bonta will investigate the fatal police shooting of a man on Hollywood Boulevard this week.
item.content:encoded: Flexing new authority, California Atty. Gen. Rob Bonta will investigate the fatal police shooting of a man on Hollywood Boulevard this week.

media:content.media:description: Body camera footage shows a man pointing an object at LAPD officers just before the officers fatally shot him on Hollywood Boulevard.
